page.title: 09WILDLIFE AROUND BUCHANAN
page.content: Mallard duck. This bird is found in the fields,woodland,marshes and even in low trees. The mallard eats fish, insects,frogs,grain,snails and berries. During the summer the mallard stays near fresh water (Mar burn). In winter it goes along the seashore. Red and Grey squirrel.The red squirrel is found mainly in the pine woods around here.The grey squirrel,which was brought to Britain from N.America is more common. We see more grey squirrels here. A squirrel's nest is called a drey. Roe deer. These live on moorland or in the woods. The male has antlers but the doe does not. They eat twigs and young shoots and do a lot of damage to the trees. Fox.The fox goes hunting at night for birds,rabbits and poultry. He is a nuisance on the farms here.
